channel.title: NASA Breaking News
channel.description: A RSS news feed containing the latest NASA news articles and press releases.

item.title: NASA Funds Projects to Study Orbital Debris, Space Sustainability
item.description: As part of NASA's efforts to address orbital debris, the agency is funding research proposals from three university-based teams over the next year to analyze the economic, social, and policy issues associated with space sustainability.

item.title: NASA Announces Pending Departure of Science Associate Administrator
item.description: Dr. Thomas Zurbuchen, associate administrator of NASA’s Science Mission Directorate, will leave the agency at the end of 2022, after six years of dedicated service.

item.title: Georgia, Illinois Students to Hear from Space Station Astronauts
item.description: Students from Georgia and Illinois will have the opportunity this week to hear from astronauts aboard the International Space Station.

item.title: NASA to Host Briefing on Perseverance Mars Rover Mission Operations
item.description: NASA will host a briefing at 11:30 a.m. EDT (8:30 a.m. PDT) on Thursday, Sept. 15, at the agency’s Jet Propulsion Laboratory in Southern California to provide highlights from the first year and a half of the Perseverance rover’s exploration of Mars.

item.title: NASA Hosts National Space Council Meeting, Vice President Chairs Event
item.description: Vice President Kamala Harris highlighted the importance of climate, human spaceflight, and STEM education during the Biden-Harris Administration’s second National Space Council meeting Friday, held at NASA’s Johnson Space Center in Houston.

item.title: NASA to Host National Space Council Meeting at Johnson Space Center
item.description: NASA to Host National Space Council Meeting at Johnson Space Center

item.title: NASA to Discuss Status of Next Artemis I Moon Mission Launch Attempt
item.description: NASA will hold a media teleconference at 11 a.m. EDT Thursday, Sept. 8, to discuss next steps for the Artemis I mission to launch the Space Launch System (SLS) rocket and Orion spacecraft from the agency’s Kennedy Space Center in Florida.

item.title: NASA Taps Axiom Space for First Artemis Moonwalking Spacesuits
item.description: NASA has selected Axiom Space to deliver a moonwalking system for the Artemis III mission, which will land Americans on the surface of the Moon for the first time in over 50 years. This award – the first one under a competitive spacesuits contract – is for a task order to develop a next generation Artemis spacesuit and supporting systems, and to de

item.title: NASA Awards Contract for Marshall’s Mission Operations
item.description: NASA has awarded the Marshall Operations Systems, Services, and Integration II (MOSSI II) contract to Teledyne Brown Engineering Inc. of Huntsville, Alabama.

item.title: NASA to Provide Artemis I Launch Update Saturday
item.description: Following the Artemis I launch scrub Saturday from Launch Complex 39B at NASA’s Kennedy Space Center in Florida, the agency will hold a media briefing no earlier than 4 p.m. EDT on Saturday Sept. 3, to discuss mission status.
